name: Encounter
description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.short: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
elements.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

elements.name: status
elements.short: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
elements.description: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: No clear equivalent in HL7 v2; active/finished could be inferred from PV1-44, PV1-45, PV2-24; inactive could be inferred from PV2-16

elements.name: statusHistory
elements.short: List of past encounter statuses
elements.description: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

elements.description: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

elements.name: period
elements.short: The time that the episode was in the specified status
elements.description: The time that the episode was in the specified status.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: class
elements.short: Classification of patient encounter
elements.description: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: classHistory
elements.short: List of past encounter classes
elements.description: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

elements.name: type
elements.short: Specific type of encounter
elements.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: serviceType
elements.short: Specific type of service
elements.description: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

binding.description: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: priority
elements.short: Indicates the urgency of the encounter
elements.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

binding.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.short: The patient or group present at the encounter
elements.description: The patient or group present at the encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: episodeOfCare
elements.short: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
elements.description: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: basedOn
elements.short: The ServiceRequest that initiated this encounter
elements.description: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: participant
elements.short: List of participants involved in the encounter
elements.description: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

elements.short: Role of participant in encounter
elements.description: Role of participant in encounter.

elements.name: period
elements.short: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated
elements.description: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: individual
elements.short: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
elements.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: appointment
elements.short: The appointment that scheduled this encounter
elements.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: The start and end time of the encounter
elements.description: The start and end time of the encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: length
elements.short: Quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
elements.description: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (PV1-45 less PV1-44) iff ( (PV1-44 not empty) and (PV1-45 not empty) ); units in minutes

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.short: Coded reason the encounter takes place
elements.description: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

binding.description: Reason why the encounter takes place.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.short: Reason the encounter takes place (reference)
elements.description: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

elements.name: condition
elements.short: The diagnosis or procedure relevant to the encounter
elements.description: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Resources that would commonly referenced at Encounter.indication would be Condition and/or Procedure. These most closely align with DG1/PRB and PR1 respectively.

elements.name: use
elements.short: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge …)
elements.description: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge …).

binding.description: The type of diagnosis this condition represents.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: rank
elements.short: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
elements.description: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

elements.name: account
elements.short: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter
elements.description: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: location
elements.short: Location the encounter takes place
elements.description: The location where the encounter takes place.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: planned | active | reserved | completed
elements.description: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: physicalType
elements.short: The physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierachy - bed room ward etc.)
elements.description: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
elements.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: serviceProvider
elements.short: The organization (facility) responsible for this encounter
elements.description: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (which may be billed seperately) for an external consultation.  Refer to the example bundle showing an abbreviated set of Encounters for a colonoscopy.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: partOf
elements.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
elements.description: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
